bibl.title: The Date of the Astronomical Almanac Tab. Amst. inv. 1.
bibl.note: T. Amst. Inv. 1 [ed.: Otto NEUGEBAUER, P.J. SIJPESTEIJN and K.A. WORP, A Greek Planetary Table, ChrEg 52 (1977) No. 104, pp. 301-310, 3 figg., 1 pl.]. A unique date, 24 B.C., gives an excellent fit for all the planets except Mercury, the recorded positions of which seem to have been thrown off by a systematic error.
bibl.seg: JONES Alexander, The Date of the Astronomical Almanac Tab. Amst. inv. 1.

T. Amst. Inv. 1 [ed.: Otto NEUGEBAUER, P.J. SIJPESTEIJN and K.A. WORP, A Greek Planetary Table, ChrEg 52 (1977) No. 104, pp. 301-310, 3 figg., 1 pl.]. A unique date, 24 B.C., gives an excellent fit for all the planets except Mercury, the recorded positions of which seem to have been thrown off by a systematic error.
